intro: Morinda coreia var. stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf red root, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, followed by orange-red berries. Its roots are valued in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions with well-drained soil and partial shade.
